snippet: Bruce Rauner, a political first-timer and multimillionaire businessman, is seen as the front-runner in Illinois’s Republican primary for governor.
abstract: Bruce Rauner, who is seen as front-runner in Illinois Republican primary for governor, is drawing attention from Democrats and Republicans alike as a strong candidate against Gov Pat Quinn; Democrats have maintained single-party control of the state government for more than a decade, and Republicans see Rauner as perhaps the strongest chance in the nation to seize a governor's office from Democrats.
lead_paragraph: Bruce Rauner, a political first-timer and multimillionaire businessman, is seen as the front-runner in Illinois’s Republican primary for governor.

headline.main: In Illinois, Republicans See an Office Up for Grabs
headline.print_headline: In Illinois, Republicans See an Office Up for Grabs
